descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing proficient new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the experienced contributor stock by recognizing and advancing active members.
The promotion rate flow increases the core developer stock by elevating qualified experienced contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates the skill up flow by providing direct mentorship and guidance.
Increased implicit knowledge transfer accelerates the promotion rate by preparing contributors for advanced roles.
More core developers increase the capacity for implicit knowledge transfer through mentorship and code review.
Explicit knowledge transfer facilitates the skill up flow by providing accessible learning resources and documentation.
The colored stock represents the pool of potential contributors who can join as new contributors.
A larger stock of new contributors increases the potential inflow for the skill up flow.
A larger core developer stock can increase turnover due to burnout or new career opportunities.
A larger stock of experienced contributors provides more candidates eligible for the promotion rate flow.
